description: Stroll from Addington Village to Upper Shirley to hear about ancient roads, buildings of former local trades, the medieval St. Mary's Church,  Addington Palace, post-war urban planning and a nursing home updated for the 21st century.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: See a fascinating mix of architecture from a Medieval church- burial site of five Archbishops of Canterbury-  traditional village trades passing the Old Forge, the 18th century Addington Palace and an arresting view contrasting with the 1960s tower blocks in the distance, visible in nearby New Addington.

images.title: Doyle of London- Southeast view of the Church of St. Mary the Blessed Virgin, Addington

location.address: St. Mary's Church, Addington Village Road, Croydon, CR0 5AU
travel_info: Additional travel info: Nearest tram stop: Addington Village or Gravel Hill

name: Addington Village to Upper Shirley
